The key is to show up-remote or face to face!

Technology update:
Last spring we had 183 families district-wide that needed a hot spot to engage in online learning. This summer, we surveyed families and a similar number indicated they did not have internet at home. However, when we began distributing devices, we had over 370 families pick-up or request a hot spot.

Likewise, last spring 89% of elementary students had a device at home to engage in online learning. So far this fall, 60% of elementary students have requested a district device.

We've had to expend funds to purchase additional hot spots and pull laptops out of classrooms to distribute to students. We will be reaching out to families who have requested devices or hot spots as they become available.

We appreciate your patience while we continuously work to ensure all of our students will have the devices they need to be successful.

post_text: Board Spotlight: Dr. Charles Bardwell currently serves on our board of trustee’s as secretary. Dr. Bardwell has recently completed his Master Trustee certification through Leadership TASB (Texas Association of School Boards). He was one of only 36 board members selected statewide. This is a yearlong program that takes experienced board members to a new level of service and leadership by exposing them to a variety of issues, people, activities, and locations. We have had two other board members complete this certification including our current board president, Mr. Matt Dutton and a former board member, Bruce Johnson. We appreciate Dr. Bardwell’s dedication to Huffman ISD and going above and beyond for our community.

It is with sadness we announce the passing of a former Huffman Superintendent, Douglass Shands. Mr. Shands lost his battle with Parkinson's on Monday, August 17th. He was 79 years old. He is survived by his wife, Julie Shands, and their three children and their spouses and children. His three children and two son-in-laws are graduates of Hargrave High School.

Kathy Shands Wright and Jimmy Wright, class of 1979
Stephen Shands, class of 1982
Chad Smith, class of 1990
Laura Shands Smith, class of 1991

Mr. Shands was employed in Huffman ISD from 1972-1989 serving as principal of Huffman Middle School, Director of Auxiliary Services, Business Manager, Assistant Superintendent, and Superintendent.

In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Huffman Education Foundation in his memory.

Thank you Mr. Shands for your years of service to Huffman ISD.

Due to the current statewide restrictions enacted by Governor Abbott’s executive orders, we will, unfortunately, have to make changes to our May 30th graduation ceremony plans. The May 30th ceremony date has been canceled.

#TALONSUP

shared_text:
Huffman Visual Arts
March 5 at 7:26 PM ·

Today we celebrated Big Art Day in Huffman, Texas! We had plenty of art activities going on in our Huffman ISD community.
The Hargrave High School Art Club and advanced art students taught a cross curricular literacy and art lesson to 1st graders. This week was Dr Seuss’s birthday so they read Fox in Socks and then created Fox in Socks themed art. Both the Hargrave High Schoolers and the Huffman Elementary 1st graders from Mrs Cobbley’s class had a great time teaching and learning from each other.
We also had our Hargrave High School students create positive designs around the Huffman Elementary School campus. They created a mural and made designs in different bathrooms from PreK to 3rd grade.
Finally along with help from Huffman Middle Schoolers we painted ceiling tiles for and representing Huffman EMS to be used at Memorial Herman Northeast ER room.
Our students had a wonderful time spreading art awareness, positive inspiring messages, and art for all of our Huffman community to see.
#bigartday20
